text: Peter Jonathan Westbrook (April 16, 1952 â€“ November 29, 2024) was an American saber fencer. He was a 13-time national and 3-time Pan American Games saber champion. He won a bronze medal at the 1984 Summer Olympics. He was also the founder of the Peter Westbrook Foundation (PWF), a non-profit organization that uses fencing as a way to help young people in New York City communities. Westbrook was born in St. Louis, Missouri. Westbrook died from liver cancer at a hospital in New York City on November 29, 2024, at the age of 72. ==References== ==Other websites== * The Peter Westbrook Foundation * "The Right Touch," by Finn-Olaf Jones, about Peter Westbrook Foundation, in "Forbes," September 18, 2006 Category:1952 births Category:2024 deaths Category:Deaths from liver cancer Category:American fencers Category:Olympic bronze medalists for the United States Category:Sportspeople from St. Louis, Missouri Category:Sportspeople from New York City Category:Philanthropists from Missouri Category:Philanthropists from New York (state)
title: Peter Westbrook
